[[File:1.21 Pre-Release 2 banner_patterns.png-atlas.png|200px|thumb|<samp>banner_patterns.png-atlas</samp> in [[Java Edition 1.21.9]].]]

'''<samp>banner_patterns.png-atla</samp>''' is a procedurally-generated [[texture atlas]] used to store textures for [[banner]]s and all [[banner pattern]]s.

== Format ==
<samp>banner_patterns.png-atlas</samp> is a fixed-width 512&times;512-pixel file that store textures for all banner patterns.

== History ==
{{HistoryTable
|{{HistoryLine|java}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.15|dev=Pre-release 1|Added <samp>banner_patterns.png-atlas</samp>, following the splitting of <samp>[[textures-atlas]]</samp>.}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.19.3|dev=22w42a|As an optimization to resource pack loading, everything in the relevant directory is compiled into this atlas, rather than only those sprites which are used by the game.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=22w46a|A customizable atlas json file has been added which can be used to control which graphics are added to this atlas.}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.19.4|dev=Pre-release 3|The way in which sprites are arranged on atlases has been changed considerably, resulting in atlas dimensions being generally smaller.
|This atlas can now be exported to the screenshots folder using F3+S.}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.21.9|dev=25w31a|Mipmapped versions of this atlas are no longer generated.}}
}}

==== Mipmapped versions ====
''Minecraft'' also previously generated mipmapped versions of this atlas, for unknown reasons. They are not used by the game at all - only blocks placed in the world which use the json model system use mipmapped textures.<ref>{{bug|MC-277481}}</ref>. The mipmapped version no longer generates in [[1.21.9]].
